Description: Attic pottery squat lekythos, complete except for a chip from the rim; rim glazed in and out; neck reserved with some black lines; net pattern on body with white dots; edge of foot, black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Bulas group, a group of miniature vessels characterised by net ornament often enlivened with added white applied directly to the clay ground. For the group see J. D. Beazley, "Miniature Panathenaics," BSA 41 (1940-45) 10-21; C. Bulas, "Etude sur une Classe de Vases a Decor," BCH 56 (1932) 388-98.'
Naukratis provided several examples of Attic squat lekythos decorated with net pattern. Another of them is also relatively well preserved (BM 1885,1101.65).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 111, no. 393, pl. 82)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1964)
